alert.note: Alert for Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 17 at 2:32AM CST until February 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected, starting off as a wintry mix. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. The higher accumulations will be confined to the north and west portion of the county near the Kansas border. In addition, north winds will gust as high as 45 mph and could cause near blizzard conditions during the mid morning hours across the north and west portion of the county. * WHERE...Osage County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Near blizzard conditions during the morning hours could make travel difficult within the heavy snow band.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
